title_tag: Find Happiness after Your Vacation \' always-vacation.com
meta_description: When vacations end, we often feel depressed and anxious about returning to mundane daily life. Use these tips to find happiness after your vacation.

about.title: About Mara Dupre
about.content:
Hello! I\'m Mara. My job as a travel agent is to help people design a vacation they can afford and that they\'ll enjoy. It\'s a pleasure to work with people from all walks of life-singles, families, retirees, newlyweds, etc.-and my career has shown me significant insight into the psychology behind vacations. Planning a vacation can be an incredibly emotional experience, especially when traveling far away or coordinating with companions. It\'s difficult to get time off from work and even more difficult to make kids behave on the plane. Then, after the vacation is over, new emotions settle in. These can be even more powerful than those that keep us up at night in the days leading up to a trip.
As much as I enjoy helping people plan their vacations, I also want to help them unwind after they get back home. That was the inspiration behind this blog; I wanted to show people how to reintegrate themselves into their day-to-day lives without losing any of the magic of their vacation. I hope that some of these tips will make returning from your next trip a little more enjoyable and a lot less stressful. Vacations are wonderful, but the return back home should be wonderful too.ves into their day-to-day lives without losing any of the magic of their vacation. page1.slider_content: Unwind from vacations more effectively with these tips.
page1.title: Unwind from Vacation by Maintain
page1.content:
The days and weeks following a spectacular vacation can undo all that de-stressing and relaxation you accomplished while away. To unwind from vacation, maintaining \"your\" time is essential so you don\'t get mired in the craziness of returning to the status quo.

Disconnect from the Internet

During your week on a Vancouver beach or three-day weekend at a British Columbia mountain resort, you probably neglected your Twitter feed and Facebook page. When you return, resist the urge to caption every vacation photo for your eager friends and followers. In fact, stay away from the Internet as much as possible as you get back in the groove of everyday life. You might need your computer for work, but as soon as you get home, decompress without benefit of technology and stay focused on the relaxation your vacation instilled in you.

Focus on Family

Whether your vacation was with your family or not, focus on them after you get home. Put together a vacation scrapbook with photos and other memorabilia, or watch videos of your kids paragliding from the peak of Grouse Mountain. You might also want to reconnect with friends, but avoid big get-togethers or wild parties. Instead, invite a few of your closest pals over for a quiet meal or out to the movies to catch up on the blockbusters you\'ve missed.

Set Aside \"Me Time\"

Don\'t neglect yourself after you get home from vacation. In fact, make your personal health and wellness a priority as you ease back into your normal routine. Set aside half an hour or so at the end of every day to do something you enjoy, such as reading or watching a few minutes of guilty-pleasure television. Of course, \"me time\" only works if the people you live with know not to disturb you. If nothing else, hang a sign on your doorknob hotel-style that warns your spouse and kids to keep out. Their question or issue will still be there when you\'re done with your me-time activity.

Find a Source of Relaxation

While vacations are custom-built for relaxation, you can apply those same principles to \"real life.\" Find your own personal source of relaxation, whether it\'s an indulgent bubble bath before bed or writing observations in a journal. Vacations teach us to relax, so don\'t forget those lessons. Embrace them even after you get home.

page2.slider_content: Relive vacation memories with these effective strategies.
page2.title: 4 Tips to Travel More Frequently
page2.content:
The travel bug usually bites after you return from a great vacation. You\'re invigorated by the time away and anxious to do it again. Unfortunately, travel often presents a logistical nightmare. If you\'re interested in seeing the world, use these 4 tips to make it a reality.

1. Apply for a Travel-Oriented Job

Lots of jobs include travel in your responsibilities, while others simply aren\'t based in a specific location, so you can perform them no matter where you are. A travel writer or photographer, for example, makes a living by reporting on the places he or she visits. There are opportunities across dozens of industries, such as: START BULLETED LIST Travel nurse or doctor Pilot or flight attendant Cruise line employee Recruiter (for employers, schools, military, etc.) END BULLETED LIST

2. Plan Vacation Time Strategically

How much you can travel depends not on how much vacation time you have but on how you use it. If you allocate a certain percentage of your vacation days to travel, play each excursion down to the minute so you get the most time possible. One popular way to maximize vacation days is to surround holiday weekends with them. Over Thanksgiving, for example, you might get two days off already, plus the weekend. Add two vacation days, and you\'ve got 6 full travel days to fill.

3. Take Lots of Day Trips

When you feel compelled to travel, pull out a map of your city. Pinpoint all the destinations within a three-hour drive (or longer, depending on your unique circumstances), then start checking them off. Theoretically, you could cover two per weekend without missing any work. Weekend trips work for longer treks, especially if you can leave Friday after work and fly back Monday morning. Just make sure to catch a few winks on the plane or your boss will wonder if he should recommend you for a mental health evaluation.

page3.slider_content: Travel more often by implementing these suggestions.
page3.title: 5 Ways to Relive Vacation Memories
page3.content:
When you come home from vacation, you don\'t want to forget all the wonderful things you saw, did, and felt. Fortunately, there are several ways to keep your vacation alive, so follow these step to relive vacation memories over the coming months.

1. Sort Through Photos

These days, nobody checks the mail-much less takes a vacation-without a camera handy. Eject the memory card on your digital camera or connect your phone to the computer and start downloading. Spend the next few weeks sorting photos into categories, tagging them with the people in the images, and editing them until they match what you saw with your eyes.

2. Watch Videos

The advancements in cell phone design ensure nobody ever walks out the door without a video camera in his or her pocket. Pull up those stored videos so you can relive vacation memories in perfect 1080p. If you vacationed with a group of friends or family members, trade videos with everyone else so you all have as many records as possible.

3. Recount Anecdotes

No, you shouldn\'t tell the story about the clogged toilet in your hotel room for the third time. However, make a point to recount your favorite-and most entertaining-anecdotes so they stay fresh in your mind. Just try to avoid monopolizing all conversations because your invitations to future get-togethers might inexplicably get lost in the mail.

4. Display a Keepsake

The ugly snow globe you snagged in the airport gift shop might earn a sacred spot on your fireplace mantel despite its gaudiness. Displaying vacation keepsakes will surprise you with floods of memories every time you glance in their direction. Of course, it\'s better to find an attractive keepsake you won\'t mind displaying proudly in your home.

5. Keep the Vacation Going

Just because you aren\'t hiking to the top of a mountain or back floating in the Atlantic surf doesn\'t mean you can\'t keep the vacation going. Relive vacation memories by pursuing something you enjoyed on your trip. If you found you loved antiquing, search out antique malls in your hometown. Reliving vacation memories will help you maintain the euphoric glow you acquired while on your trip. It also fuels your desire to take another vacation-the sooner the better-so you\'re energized and willing to work toward that goal.

homepage.content:
[widgetkit id=ab_slider_id]

Commit to Happiness after Your Vacation

The End of Vacation

Most people experience mixed emotions at the end of a vacation. They might feel sad or depressed because the fun is over, but they also feel relieved to be returning to their comfortable, familiar lives.

Time at Home

Managing your time is essential while you unwind after a vacation. Focus on improving the quality of your daily activities so you aren\'t just whiling away the hours with no purpose.purpose.purpose.

Vacation Memories

Set aside time to relive vacation memories after you return, especially in the first few days. Look through photographs, watch videos, and display vacation mementos so your trip stays alive in your mind.

Travel More Frequently

Increasing travel time isn\'t easy, but you can make it happen. Use these tips to travel more often. Make it part of your job or get creative with time off.e with time off.e with time off.e with time off.e with time off.

privacy.title: Content & Privacy Policy
privacy.content: Privacy Policy of ALWAYS-VACATION.COM Types of Data collected Other Personal Data collected may be described in other sections of this privacy policy or by dedicated explanation text contextually with the Data collection. The Personal Data may be freely provided by the User, or collected automatically when using this Application. Any use of Cookies - or of other tracking tools - by this Application or by the owners of third party services used by this Application, unless stated otherwise, serves to identify Users and remember their preferences, for the sole purpose of providing the service required by the User. Failure to provide certain Personal Data may make it impossible for this Application to provide its services. The User assumes responsibility for the Personal Data of third parties published or shared through this Application and declares to have the right to communicate or broadcast them, thus relieving the Data Controller of all responsibility. Mode and place of processing the Data Method of processing The Data Controller processes the Data of Users in proper manner and shall take appropriate security measures to prevent unauthorized access, disclosure, modification or unauthorized destruction of the Data. Access to the Data may be available to Data Processors, if appointed, as well as employees involved with the processing. Access to Data may be also available to external parties providing services to the Data Controller such as third party technical service providers, mail carriers, hosting providers, IT companies, communication agencies. The updated list of these parties may be requested from the Data Controller at any time. Place The Data is processed at the Data Controller headquarters, unless stated otherwise in the rest of this document. Conservation Time The Data is kept for the time necessary to provide the service requested by the User, or stated by the purposes outlined in this document, and the User can always request the Data Controller for their suspension or removal. Additional information about Data collection and processing Legal Action The User's Personal Data may be used for legal purposes by the Data Controller, in Court or in the stages leading to possible legal action arising from improper use of this Application or the related services. Additional Information about User's Personal Data In addition to the information in this privacy policy, this Application may provide the User with contextual information concerning particular services or the collection and processing of Personal Data. System Logs and Maintenance For operation and maintenance purposes, this Application and any third party services may collect files that record interaction with this Application (System Logs) or use for this purpose other Personal Data (such as IP Address). Information not contained in this policy More details concerning the collection or processing of Personal Data may be requested from the Data Controller at any time at its contact information. The rights of Users Users have the right, at any time, to know whether their Personal Data has been stored and can consult the Data Controller to learn about their contents and origin, to verify their accuracy or to ask for them to be supplemented, cancelled, updated or corrected, or for their transformation into anonymous format or to block any data held in violation of the law, as well as to oppose their treatment for any and all legitimate reasons. Requests should be sent to the Data Controller at the contact information set out above. This Application does not support “do not track” requests. To understand if any of the third party services it uses honor the “do not track” requests, please read their privacy policies. Changes to this privacy policy The Data Controller reserves the right to make changes to this privacy policy at any time by giving notice to its Users on this page. It is strongly recommended to check this page often, referring to the date of the last modification listed at the bottom. If a User objects to any of the changes to the Policy, the User must cease using this Application and can request the Data Controller to erase the Personal Data. Unless stated otherwise, the then-current privacy policy applies to all Personal Data the Data Controller has about Users.
